description: In addition to the traditional practices of literary study, cross-disciplinary courses include
materials from at least one other academic discipline, requiring students to compare and
combine disciplinary perspectives in literary analysis. Examples of courses taught under this
heading might include Literature and Politics; Religion and the Novel; Philosophical Approaches
to Literature. May be repeated if topics are different. FYW or equivalent.
Click on course title in the Class & Lab for more information about the course for that term.
